knimeNode.name: Hough Forest Predictor
knimeNode.shortDescription: Predicts detected objects according to an aggregation of the predictions of the individual trees in a Hough forest model.

fullDescription.intro:
Predicts the location of objects in images according to an aggregation of the predictions of the individual trees in a Hough forest model.
Hough forests has been proposed in Class-Specific Hough Forests for Object Detection by Juergen Gall and Victor Lempitsky. A Hough forest can be used for object detection in images and is a special kind of random forest using a generalized form of a Hough transform to give probabilistic votes for the location of the searched objects.

tab.name: Input
tab.option: Select the image column to predict on.

tab.name: Patch Extraction
tab.option: Defines the horizontal distance of the centers of two extracted neighbored patches. The width of the patches is defined in the model. Number of patches in horizontal direction will be 1 + (image_width - patch_width) / stride_hor .

Defines the vertical distance of the centers of two extracted neighbored patches. The height of the patches is defined in the model. Number of patches in vertical direction will be 1 + (image_height - patch_height) / stride_ver .

option.name: Size of the area around found maxima

tab.name: Multiple Detection
tab.option: Select, if multiple objects should be detected. If selected, a threshold and sigma needs to be defined. If not selected, only one object will be detected which location is defined by the pixel which got the most votes.

tab.name: Scales
tab.option: Up to four scales can be selected.
